abstract.p: Sohu.com, one of China's leading Internet companies, acquires ChinaRen.com, setting stage for what is expected to be sweeping consolidation of China's fledgling Internet industry; deal is valued at about $30 million (S)

block.p: One of China's leading Internet companies announced the purchase of a smaller rival yesterday, setting the stage for what is expected to be a sweeping consolidation of China's fledgling Internet industry. Sohu.com, which went public on the Nasdaq market in July, said it would buy ChinaRen.com for 4.4 million shares, or about 12.5 percent of Sohu.com's shares outstanding. The deal values ChinaRen.com, an operator of information and e-commerce web sites popular among Chinese college students, at about $30 million.
